2018-07-01T14:56:41Z: Thanks for joining us on Autosport's live coverage of the 2018 Austrian Grand Prix - make sure you check out Autosport.com and Motorsport.com for all of the reaction from the paddock this afternoon.It's not long until we're back though, our live coverage will return this coming Friday from the opening practice sessions for the British Grand Prix.
2018-07-01T14:53:32Z: Here's our race report from an incident-packed Austrian Grand Prix Max Verstappen wins Austrian Grand Prix, both Mercedes retireMax Verstappen claimed a shock first win of the 2018 Formula 1 season at Red Bull's home race as Mercedes' challenge imploded in a dramatic Austrian Grand Prix
2018-07-01T14:43:53Z: Today's result is Sauber's first double points finish since the 2015 Chinese Grand Prix, where Felipe Nasr and Marcus Ericsson finished 8th and 10th.
2018-07-01T14:42:39Z: The top three have now headed off the track and are going to the podium.
2018-07-01T14:39:31Z: Here's there now though and talking to Mark Webber.
2018-07-01T14:39:18Z: Verstappen was so excited he forgot to park up on the start/finish straight with the Ferrari drivers.
2018-07-01T14:38:52Z: Verstappen also has a brief hug with his father Jos.
2018-07-01T14:38:34Z: Verstappen even bounced over the barrier to hug all of his crew.
2018-07-01T14:38:04Z: Verstappen climbs out of his car and salutes the crowd before jumping into his Red Bull mechanics.
2018-07-01T14:36:56Z: Leclerc passed Ericsson for ninth right at the very end of the race.
2018-07-01T14:36:35Z: Remember this is Red Bull's first win at the Red Bull Ring since it returned to the F1 calendar in 2014.
2018-07-01T14:36:21Z: Retirements: Vandoorne, Hamilton, Hartley, Ricciardo, Bottas, Hulkenberg
2018-07-01T14:36:04Z: Verstappen's win has been very well received by his legions of orange-clad fans in the grandstands.
2018-07-01T14:35:13Z: Indeed Perez has let Ocon back by for sixth.
2018-07-01T14:35:10Z: The rest of the field is lapped.
2018-07-01T14:35:01Z: Raikkonen stays ahead of Vettel to take second.
2018-07-01T14:34:50Z: Verstappen wins the Austrian Grand Prix!
2018-07-01T14:34:43Z: Will the Force India drivers swap back on the final lap? Ocon won't be happy if they don't...
2018-07-01T14:34:24Z: If Ferrari is going to swap its cars around, Raikkonen will have to back off very dramatically.
2018-07-01T14:33:53Z: Verstappen begins his final lap with a two-second lead.
2018-07-01T14:33:47Z: Vandoorne's entry to the pits was because McLaren has decided to retire his car due to concerns about the gearshifts.
2018-07-01T14:33:16Z: Onto the penultimate lap, Verstappen has a 2.4s lead, Raikkonen is 1.4s ahead of Vettel. What will Ferrari do?
2018-07-01T14:32:37Z: The grandstand packed with Verstappen fans is getting gloriously noisy now...
2018-07-01T14:32:15Z: Vandoorne pits for a third time.
2018-07-01T14:32:02Z: Raikkonen's not catching Verstappen quite fast enough to bring this to life, the gap is 2.7s with three laps left.
2018-07-01T14:31:54Z: Ericsson passes Leclerc for ninth - the double is still on for Sauber.
2018-07-01T14:31:34Z: Hamilton, helmet still on, has arrived back in the pits.
2018-07-01T14:31:04Z: Every driver but Vettel and Raikkonen has been lapped.
2018-07-01T14:30:42Z: Raikkonen nibbles another tenth of a second out of Verstappen this time around.
2018-07-01T14:30:20Z: There is a bit of a blister on the left rear of leader Verstappen's Red Bull now.
2018-07-01T14:30:15Z: A lock up from Gasly at Turn 3 put the Saubers all over his gearbox.
2018-07-01T14:29:52Z: Leclerc takes ninth from Gasly on the run to Turn 4, and Ericsson then follows his team-mate through into 10th at the next corner.
2018-07-01T14:29:40Z: Raikkonen does a new fastest lap of 1m06.975s and gets Verstappen's lead down to 2.8s with four laps left!
2018-07-01T14:28:53Z: The Sauber pair are immediately onto the rear of Gasly - could Sauber be on for its first double points finish of the season?
2018-07-01T14:28:16Z: Alonso takes eighth from Gasly with a better run out of Turn 3.
2018-07-01T14:28:04Z: Hamilton initially slowed on the hill out of Turn 1, went onto the Turn 3 runoff and then seemed to think he might be able to carry on after all. But he was told to stop a few yards later.
2018-07-01T14:27:38Z: At the rear of the pack, Sirotkin has made a late second stop to put on a fresh pair of ultrasofts.
2018-07-01T14:27:00Z: Lead gaps now: 1 Verstappen; 2 Raikkonen +3.7s; 3 Vettel +5.3s
2018-07-01T14:26:50Z: Leclerc is in danger of losing 10th to Ericsson - the Swedish driver is just 0.4s behind his Sauber team-mate.
2018-07-01T14:26:29Z: Hamilton parks the car. Vettel is now on course to take the championship lead as long as he stays in the top three. Wow, what a horrible day for Mercedes.
2018-07-01T14:25:40Z: Alonso has indeed demoted Leclerc to 11th - he seized the final points paying position on the run to Turn 4 with some DRS assistance.
2018-07-01T14:25:24Z: Vettel is still hanging on behind Raikkonen, though, they're 1.4s apart.
2018-07-01T14:24:19Z: Raikkonen is now within 3.8s of leader Verstappen with nine laps left. Verstappen is managing this situation, but too much?
2018-07-01T14:24:10Z: Worth noting that Sainz's second stop hasn't paid off yet - he's down in 13th after running solidly in the points early-on.
2018-07-01T14:23:31Z: Perez blasts by Ocon for P7 at Turn 3 - that looked planned even though the Mexican driver had a massive advantage with DRS.
2018-07-01T14:23:30Z: At the moment, Vettel is on course to reduce Hamilton's championship lead from 14 to 11 points. If Ferrari decides to deploy team orders, that could be an eight-point gap. Raikkonen is 62 points off Hamilton.
2018-07-01T14:22:03Z: Alonso is running just 1.2s behind Leclerc - does the double world champion sniff a point?
2018-07-01T14:21:04Z: Gaps now: 1 Verstappen; 2 Raikkonen +4.3s; 3 Vettel +6.8s; 4 Hamilton +27.8s. 12 laps to go.
2018-07-01T14:20:44Z: Vettel goes a new fastest lap of 1m07.301s, which Hamilton immediately beats with a 1m07.241s.
2018-07-01T14:20:41Z: Hartley's retirement has promoted that bloke no one ever talks about - Leclerc - into 10th place.
2018-07-01T14:19:45Z: The two Haas drivers are still running a comfortable fifth and sixth. We're not going to say anything that jinxes Grosjean here.
2018-07-01T14:19:10Z: Replays show that Hartley suffered a mechanical issue - possible gearbox or hydraulics - as he ran through the penultimate corner, which spat him off the road and killed his drive.
2018-07-01T14:18:57Z: Another new fastest lap from Hamilton, a 1m07.460s. But that's only three tenths better than the Ferraris ahead and he's got a 20s+ gap to close in 14 laps.
2018-07-01T14:18:33Z: And Hartley has now pulled off the track on the run up to Turn 3 - he's out of the race.
2018-07-01T14:18:11Z: The Ferraris are still chipping away at Verstappen's lead, which is now down to 5.3s.
2018-07-01T14:17:38Z: Hartley is able to get going.
2018-07-01T14:17:20Z: Hartley off at the final corners.
2018-07-01T14:16:44Z: Hamilton puts in a new fastest race lap of 1m07.571s. He's 21s behind Vettel and 29s off the lead with 16 laps to go.
2018-07-01T14:15:57Z: Ricciardo's retirement means both Toro Rosso cars are into the top 10 - but you'd expect Hartley to drop down the order when he pits.
2018-07-01T14:15:53Z: Lead order: 1 Verstappen; 2 Raikkonen +5.4s; 3 Vettel +7.1s; 4 Hamilton +29.4s
2018-07-01T14:14:48Z: There's also a touch of smoke from the back of Ricciardo's car. It seems to have cleared but that did look a bit worrying.
2018-07-01T14:14:23Z: Worth pointing out again in light of Hamilton's complaints about tyres - Hartley is still yet to pit! He's done over 50 laps on his supersofts.
2018-07-01T14:14:21Z: Ricciardo sweeps past the pit exit as Hamilton rejoins, so the Mercedes is down to fifth - though Hamilton does have a brand new set of supersofts to play with now.
2018-07-01T14:13:41Z: Ricciardo will almost certainly take fourth from Hamilton here.
2018-07-01T14:13:01Z: Mercedes is unwrapping tyres in the garage...
2018-07-01T14:11:44Z: Hamilton, meanwhile, has fallen 2.4s away from Vettel in fourth.
2018-07-01T14:11:30Z: Another personal best from Raikkonen, though, and he takes 0.6s out of Verstappen's lead - which is now 6s with 20 laps left.
2018-07-01T14:11:26Z: Alonso sets a personal best second sector in his pursuit of Leclerc for P12.
2018-07-01T14:10:25Z: Raikkonen hears us talking about team orders and does his best lap yet, narrowing Verstappen's lead to 6.6s and inching 1.8s clear of Vettel.
2018-07-01T14:09:33Z: Magnussen passes Ocon for seventh place.
2018-07-01T14:08:43Z: Vettel has now closed to witihn 1.5s of Raikkonen and is regularly lapping a touch quicker. Team orders time soon...?
2018-07-01T14:07:51Z: So now Hartley is the only driver yet to pit - he's done 46 laps on one set of supersofts.
2018-07-01T14:07:48Z: Leaders: 1 Verstappen; 2 Raikkonen +7.0s; 3 Vettel +8.6s; 4 Hamilton +9.5s; 5 Ricciardo +28.6s
2018-07-01T14:07:20Z: Ericsson pits for the first time - he rejoins in P14 on the supersoft tyres.
2018-07-01T14:07:17Z: But Ricciardo immediately beats Hamilton's fastest lap with a 1m07.591s, three and a half tenths quicker.
2018-07-01T14:06:59Z: Hamilton, and his tyre blister, do a new fastest lap of 1m07.923s, bringing him back to within 0.6s of Vettel.
2018-07-01T14:06:05Z: Ricciardo's now going for it with several new fastest sector times. But the margins are small, he's only trimming a few tenths at a time from the cars ahead.
2018-07-01T14:04:29Z: A slow-ish lap from leader Verstappen means Raikkonen is now within 6.5s of him with 26 laps to go.
2018-07-01T14:04:28Z: Magnussen is still just 0.5s behind Ocon in P8.
2018-07-01T14:03:39Z: So Ericsson and Hartley are still yet to pit - they're now running in 10th and 12th.
2018-07-01T14:02:58Z: Vandoorne pits again from his lonely last place, he's back out on new soft tyres.
2018-07-01T14:02:46Z: Hamilton has now closed back in on Vettel after a slow lap from the Ferrari.
2018-07-01T14:02:17Z: Magnussen is now putting Ocon under pressure for seventh.
2018-07-01T14:01:45Z: Though he now has supersoft tyres, albeit used ones, Ricciardo isn't making any headway back towards the leaders, lapping at the same pace as all those ahead rather than any quicker.
2018-07-01T14:00:54Z: This is actually becoming a pretty good race - which it really didn't look like it would be as the Mercedes one-two formation stormed away in the early laps.
2018-07-01T14:00:28Z: Vettel has pulled over a second clear of Hamilton already, and both the Ferraris are catching leader Verstappen with 30 laps left.
2018-07-01T14:00:11Z: Ocon is having a quietly impressive race - he's up to seventh, 10.7s behind Grosjean.
2018-07-01T13:59:38Z: Order: 1 Verstappen; 2 Raikkonen +7.1s; 3 Vettel +9.4s; 4 Hamilton +10.8s; 5 Ricciardo +30.0s
2018-07-01T13:59:18Z: But while Mercedes is reassuring Hamilton, he's being overtaken by his title rival on older tyres...
2018-07-01T13:58:34Z: Ricciardo has taken on supersofts and rejoined fifth, 19s behind Hamilton.
2018-07-01T13:58:18Z: Vettel attacked out of Turn 1, Hamilton tried to squeeze him but Vettel kept his car in there and surged through to third. Brilliant move.
2018-07-01T13:57:42Z: Ricciardo gives up on these tyres and pits.
2018-07-01T13:57:05Z: Nothing Ricciardo can do on the next straight though, as Raikkonen cruises past to take second before Turn 4.
2018-07-01T13:56:47Z: Raikkonen tries down the outside into Turn 3 but is held off.
2018-07-01T13:56:38Z: Raikkonen closes in on Ricciardo again as they approach traffic. Verstappen's lead is up to 6.9s.
2018-07-01T13:56:14Z: But Alonso will certainly be pleased to pass Stroll for P14 on the run to Turn 4.
2018-07-01T13:55:52Z: Raikkonen has a go at Ricciardo down the outside into Turn 4, without success.
2018-07-01T13:55:49Z: Alonso has now been lapped - that will please him.
2018-07-01T13:55:35Z: Hamilton has suddenly fallen 1.5s away from Raikkonen's tail. Vettel is within DRS range of Hamilton...
2018-07-01T13:55:19Z: Replays show Sainz had to wait in the pitlane for his right-front tyre to be fitted properly.
2018-07-01T13:54:34Z: Sainz emerges in 17th - and he's now gone onto the supersoft tyres.
2018-07-01T13:54:22Z: There's now just 3.3s covering Ricciardo, Raikkonen, Hamilton and Vettel in second to fifth.
2018-07-01T13:53:56Z: Now Perez has demoted Sainz to 10th - the Force India driver got by down the inside of Turn 3.
2018-07-01T13:53:54Z: Slow-motion replays show the extent of those blisters on the left rear of Ricciardo's car. That doesn't look like a tyre that wants to do 36 more laps.
2018-07-01T13:53:15Z: Alonso is again in danger of being lapped - and we're only just at the halfway point of this 71-lap race.
2018-07-01T13:52:05Z: Verstappen has extended his lead to 5.8s as Ricciardo's pace behind appears to fade.
2018-07-01T13:51:56Z: Replays show Magnussen passed Sainz for eighth at the inside of Turn 3.
2018-07-01T13:51:24Z: Vettel is going to make it a four-way fight for second soon, he's lapping faster than Ricciardo, Raikkonen and Hamilton ahead.
2018-07-01T13:51:12Z: Hartley is the only driver not on the soft tyres - he's on the supersofts - as Ericsson started on the yellow walled Pirelli rubber.
2018-07-01T13:50:33Z: The only drivers yet to stop are Ericsson in 11th and Hartley in 13th.
2018-07-01T13:49:59Z: Grosjean is back up to sixth and looks like he'll be pretty lonely from here - 25s behind Vettel but 8s clear of Ocon behind.
2018-07-01T13:49:20Z: Leaders: 1 Verstappen; 2 Ricciardo +4.9s; 3 Raikkonen +5.9s; 4 Hamilton +6.7s; 5 Vettel +8.7s
2018-07-01T13:48:53Z: Raikkonen locks up at Turn 3, does this give Hamilton a chance?
2018-07-01T13:48:37Z: Raikkonen has closed right in on Ricciardo for second and brought Hamilton with him.
2018-07-01T13:47:07Z: Magnussen rejoins ninth, so failing to pit under VSC has cost him places to Ocon and Sainz.
2018-07-01T13:46:48Z: Hamilton is within 0.6s of Raikkonen - DRS range...
2018-07-01T13:46:29Z: Leclerc mugs Stroll with a dive at the inside of Turn 3 and steals P14.
2018-07-01T13:46:06Z: Perez rejoins 11th, which means if Magnussen pits from sixth soon he has a chance of staying in the points in 10th.
2018-07-01T13:45:40Z: Leclerc attacks Stroll at Turn 4 with a late dive - but Stroll holds on around the outside of the next corner!
2018-07-01T13:45:35Z: Perez pits from seventh, elevating Grosjean.
2018-07-01T13:45:14Z: Hamilton does his best lap of the race so far and closes to within 1.1s of Raikkonen for third.
2018-07-01T13:44:59Z: Leclerc is pressring Stroll for P14.
2018-07-01T13:43:54Z: Lead order now: 1 Verstappen; 2 Ricciardo +4.1s; 3 Raikkonen +5.6s; 4 Hamilton +7.3s; 5 Vettel +9.0s
2018-07-01T13:43:39Z: Hamilton's stop has reprieved Alonso from getting lapped - for now.
2018-07-01T13:43:25Z: Vettel was closing in over the last few laps, it looks like Mercedes focused on the title and decided it had to get Hamilton out ahead of Vettel at all costs.
2018-07-01T13:43:09Z: Sainz gets a reprimand from the stewards for the lap one clash with Ocon - there haven't been any replays of that incident, but the pair did seem to get very close on the run up the hill heading to Turn 3.
2018-07-01T13:42:56Z: Hamilton rejoins fourth, just ahead of Vettel.
2018-07-01T13:42:47Z: Hamilton is down to fourth at least...
2018-07-01T13:42:35Z: Verstappen moves into the race lead!
2018-07-01T13:42:28Z: Hamilton is set to drop to fourth or fifth with this stop.
2018-07-01T13:42:10Z: At the 25-lap mark, McLaren is in real danger of having both cars lapped already as Alonso is already 1m06s behind Hamilton.
2018-07-01T13:41:17Z: Perez rose to seventh by not pitting under the VSC. Grosjean is 1.8s behind him in eighth on fresh tyres and in line to move back up to sixth.
2018-07-01T13:40:43Z: Stroll is now under a second behind Hartley, which makes it a three-car scrap for 12th with Ericsson.
2018-07-01T13:40:23Z: Magnussen is also yet to pit in sixth place, and could fall outside the top 10 when he does.
2018-07-01T13:39:53Z: Lead order: 1 Hamilton; 2 Verstappen +13.0s; 3 Ricciardo +16.4s; 4 Raikkonen +17.9s; 5 Vettel +22.3s
2018-07-01T13:38:34Z: Hartley is closing in on Ericsson in P12, the Toro Rosso driver is just over one second behind.
2018-07-01T13:38:21Z: Hamilton and Verstappen are lapping at the same pace, both 1m08.4s. So the gap remains 13s - 7s under what Hamilton needs to make his pitstop.
2018-07-01T13:37:57Z: Race control confirms it won't take any action over Raikkonen and Verstappen's lap one brush.
2018-07-01T13:37:34Z: Ricciardo celebrates with a new fastest race lap of 1m08.201s.
2018-07-01T13:37:22Z: Raikkonen had gone too fast into Turn 3 again, got a slide on and then tried to defend to the inside towards Turn 4 but the DRS-enabled Ricciardo was already flying past.
2018-07-01T13:36:33Z: Easy for Ricciardo in the end, he sweeps past Raikkonen down the outside into Turn 4 and has third place.
2018-07-01T13:36:14Z: Raikkonen goes wide at Turn 3 again and Ricciardo attacks.
2018-07-01T13:34:14Z: Order: 1 Hamilton; 2 Verstappen +13.2s; 3 Raikkonen +16.4s; 4 Ricciardo +16.9s; 5 Vettel +22.8s; 6 Magnussen +26.0s; 7 Perez +28.0s; 8 Grosjean +31.5s
2018-07-01T13:33:58Z: Ericsson is just 0.7s behind Sirotkin, who is up to 11th - that's the closest fight in the field right now.
2018-07-01T13:32:25Z: So Hamilton's lead is 13.1s but he hasn't made his pitstop and everyone behind him has.
2018-07-01T13:32:07Z: Magnussen didn't pit either, that briefly put him ahead of Vettel but the Ferrari instantly repasses the Haas.
2018-07-01T13:32:02Z: Ocon, Sainz, Sirotkin, Gasly, Leclerc and Alonso all pitted under the VSC.
2018-07-01T13:31:17Z: Hamilton is staying out, surely he'll come in next time around?
2018-07-01T13:30:52Z: Verstappen, Raikkonen, Ricciardo and Vettel dive into the pits under this VSC.
2018-07-01T13:30:37Z: Bottas has still got his helmet on as he trudges away down the grass.
2018-07-01T13:30:00Z: A virtual safety car is called so Bottas's car can be retrieved.
2018-07-01T13:29:58Z: The lastest chapter of the Gasly-Sirotkin battle now has the Toro Rosso driver back ahead and into P12.
2018-07-01T13:29:48Z: So now Hamilton leads by 7.7s over Verstappen and 12.4s over Raikkonen.
2018-07-01T13:29:07Z: Bottas pulls over and parks on the approach to Turn 4, what absolute heartbreak for the polesitter.
2018-07-01T13:28:34Z: While Hulkenberg's engine was stealing all the focus, Leclerc - who of course normally gets no attention anyway - has passed Ericsson for 15th.
2018-07-01T13:28:15Z: Raikkonen now holds fastest lap, and that's given him a little breathing space over Ricciardo for fourth.
2018-07-01T13:27:41Z: Hulkenberg's spectacular retirement drops the Germand out of ninth, and promotes Ocon and Sainz.
2018-07-01T13:26:47Z: Big old-fashioned engine incident for Hulkenberg there, he stops at Turn 1 with his car on fire.
2018-07-01T13:25:34Z: Meanwhile, Sirotkin has since re-passed Gasly for 14th.
2018-07-01T13:25:08Z: The Turn 3 thing with Verstappen and Raikkonen doesn't look like anything of note to us, but there was a tiny brush between them - enough to make the Ferrari slide - when Verstappen got past further around the lap.
2018-07-01T13:25:01Z: Next up for Leclerc is his Sauber team-mate Marcus Ericsson.
2018-07-01T13:24:24Z: Sainz and Ocon are being investigated by the stewards - presumably for the clash on the run to Turn 3 on lap one - as are Gasly and Vandoorne.
2018-07-01T13:23:12Z: And Gasly now passes Sirotkin for 14th place.
2018-07-01T13:22:58Z: Every time Ricciardo looks like he's getting close enough to Raikkonen to try something, the Ferrari pulls away on a straight.
2018-07-01T13:22:39Z: Gasly is pressuring Sirotkin for P14 - the Toro Rosso driver is just 0.4s behind the Williams driver.
2018-07-01T13:22:34Z: Another fastest lap from Hamilton, a 1m08.972s.
2018-07-01T13:22:18Z: Lead gaps: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +2.6s; 3 Verstappen +5.1s; 4 Raikkonen +7.7s; 5 Ricciardo +8.5s; 6 Vettel +10.4s
2018-07-01T13:21:26Z: Leclerc has passed Alonso for P18 - dizzying heights for two of the most talked-about drivers in F1 this season.
2018-07-01T13:20:41Z: Ricciardo has caught Raikkonen for fourth place.
2018-07-01T13:19:58Z: Hamilton's lead over Bottas is already 2.5s on lap six of 71, thanks to a fastest lap of 1m09.051s.
2018-07-01T13:19:18Z: Raikkonen had a great run at Hamilton into both Turn 1 and Turn 3, but went so wide at the hairpin and only just held off Verstappen there with a bit of a squeeze. As they both lost momentum, that gave Bottas his great run down the outside.
2018-07-01T13:18:32Z: Replays of the first lap show how eventful it was for Bottas and Raikkonen in particular.
2018-07-01T13:18:14Z: Vandoorne's nose damage occurred when he collided with Gasly at the apex of Turn 3 - the McLaren was pinched on the inside.
2018-07-01T13:18:13Z: Order: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas; 3 Verstappen; 4 Raikkonen; 5 Ricciardo; 6 Vettel; 7 Grosjean; 8 Magnussen; 9 Hulkenberg; 10 Ocon; 11 Sainz; 12 Stroll; 13 Perez; 14 Gasly; 15 Sirotkin; 16 Ericsson; 17 Hartley; 18 Alonso; 19 Leclerc; 20 Hartley
2018-07-01T13:17:03Z: The leaders are spreading out - Hamilton from Bottas, then Verstappen, Raikkonen and Ricciardo, with Vettel a further 2.2s back now he's cleared the two Haas.
2018-07-01T13:16:34Z: Leclerc's trip through the gravel has dropped him to 19th, only ahead of Vandoorne.
2018-07-01T13:16:21Z: Vettel dives past Grosjean to take sixth into the downhill Turn 4. He slews a bit wide but hold the place.
2018-07-01T13:16:06Z: There's a piece of McLaren front wing - presumably from Vandoorne's car - sitting just off the racing line at the exit of Turn 3.
2018-07-01T13:15:40Z: Leclerc is able to rejoin after skating across the gravel.
2018-07-01T13:15:28Z: Bottas's start from pole really wasn't great and he immediately lost first place. Raikkonen made the best start of all, but he couldn't make it between the two Mercedes so slotted in behind Hamilton, before things got further mixed up later in the lap.
2018-07-01T13:15:18Z: Leclerc is off in the gravel at Turn 5.
2018-07-01T13:14:53Z: Vandoorne pits - he's got front wing damage.
2018-07-01T13:14:50Z: Order: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas; 3 Verstappen; 4 Raikkonen; 5 Ricciardo; 6 Grosjean; 7 Vettel; 8 Magnussen
2018-07-01T13:14:24Z: Vettel went out wide at Turn 3 too and is down to eighth behind the two Haas, though he now passes Magnussen for seventh.
2018-07-01T13:14:07Z: Now Verstappen attacks Raikkonen and takes third.
2018-07-01T13:13:57Z: Bottas had fallen down to fourth but he goes down the outside into Turn 4 and manages to go around past Verstappen and Raikkonen into second!
2018-07-01T13:13:36Z: Possible contact between Ocon and one of the Renault drivers on the run up to Turn 3.
2018-07-01T13:13:33Z: Raikkonen tries to go down the outside of Hamilton into Turn 3 but locks up and runs wide.
2018-07-01T13:13:16Z: Raikkonen is trying to get between the two Mercedes, as Bottas falls from first to fourth and Hamilton takes the lead.
2018-07-01T13:12:15Z: Poleman Bottas brings the field round the final corner as they begin to line up on the grid.
2018-07-01T13:05:05Z: Fans of massive (and ultimately meaningless) grid penalties - and statistically there will be some who enjoy seeing them - will be delighted to know that Brendon Hartley has been sent to the back of the grid (effectively no places dropped) for taking a new engine.
2018-07-01T13:04:44Z: Fernando Alonso fans looking for the McLaren driver taking up his 14th place grid spot will instead have to look to the pitlane exit, as the double world champion is starting there after changing his front wing following qualifying Post-qualifying wing change gives Alonso Austria pitlane startFernando Alonso will start the Formula 1 Austrian Grand Prix from the pitlane after McLaren changed his front wing ahead of the race
2018-07-01T13:02:48Z: Vettel’s penalty comes a week after he collided with Bottas at Turn 1 in France.
